thread.title: Elderly man cannot get a job despite having six degrees | Daily Mail Online
thread.title_full: Elderly man cannot get a job despite having six degrees | Daily Mail Online

author: Chris Pleasance For Daily Mail Australia
title: Elderly man cannot get a job despite having six degrees | Daily Mail Online
text: comments We all know young people can struggle to get on the career ladder - but less well known is the struggle of older people to stay in work. Meet Jim, from Adelaide, who says he is unable to find any work despite having six degrees including three masters' degrees. The elderly man says he is even willing to accept voluntary work, but nobody is willing to take on an older employee. An elderly man named Jim, from Adelaide, says he is unable to get a job despite having six degrees including three Bachelors and three Masters Jim has a BA in both History and Sociology, a Bachelors in Business and HR Management, a Masters in Management, a Masters in Business Administration and a Masters in Letters in History. He is due to be featured on Today Tonight Adelaide at 6.30pm on Tuesday. Speaking to the programme, he said: 'I'm disappointed in myself that I can't get a job and I have tried. I just want something to do. I don't care if it's voluntary.' RELATED ARTICLES
